en: [Estate Sale] 1806 Feb. 27, of goods and chattels belonging to James Law, deceased
This document is an inventory of an estate sale dated February 27, 1806. The belongings of James Law, deceased, were sold at a public vendue.
This document is an inventory of an estate sale dated February 27, 1806. The belongings of James Law, deceased, were sold at a public vendue.

No Copyright - United States: The organization that has made the Item available believes that the Item is in the Public Domain under the laws of the United States, but a determination was not made as to its copyright status under the copyright laws of other countries. The Item may not be in the Public Domain under the laws of other countries. Please refer to the organization that has made the Item available for more information.

none: [Estate Sale] 1806 Feb. 27, of goods and chattels belonging to James Law, deceased : page 1

body.value: An Inventory of the goods and Chattles Chattels Belonging to the Estate of James Law Deceased and sold at publick public Vendue the 27th febry February . 1806 Purchasers Names Articles Sold Price John Helm _ 4 Spade_ 076 James Kenny _ 4 Mattock_ 080 Joseph Kerlin _ 4 Corn Hoe_ 027 Robert Macklin _ 1 falling ax_ 0108 Joseph Kerlin_ 4 Ditto_ 060 Robert Warren _ 4 old Ditto 030 Philip McCardell _ 4 Coulter_ 027 Robert Warren_ 4 Corn Hoe_ 049 Ebenezer McEwen _ 4 Cask, Auger & Cutting knife_ 046 Robert Payne _ 4 half Bushel_ 029 Lewis Jordan _ 1 fatt fat Tubb Tub _ 021 Lewis Jordan_ 1 Ditto 027 Lewis Jordan_ 4 Meat Tub 071 Philip McCardell_ 4 Cutting Box_ 100 George Gillispie _ 1 Kettle_ 153 Old Mrs. Kenny 4 Washing Tub 020 Robert Warren_ 2 Sickles_ 066 Mrs. Law _ 1 Bucket and drawing knife 021 Robert Payne_ 2 Pails 040 William Gwin _ 4 Set of horse Gears_ 0160 William Smith _ 1 Ditto_ 0171 Jesse Payne Junr Junior ._ 4 Small Plough_ 0167 Mrs. Law_ 1 Small oven 1 pot & 2 pair of hooks_ 0120 Robert Payne_ 2 Honey Crocks_ 062 Henry Payne _ 2 Small Ditto_ 019- John Williams _ 1 pair of Bedsteads_ 034 Henry Payne_ 2 Chairs_ 050 Robert Warren_ 4 Walnut Table_ 0125 Gabriel Seahorn _ 2 Chairs_ 020 Mrs. Law_ 3 Ditto_ 060 Adam Lowry _ 1 Pressing Iron_ 051 Adam Lowry_ 1 Pair of Taylors Shears_ 046 Mrs. Law_ 1 feather Bed & bedding_ 200 Mrs. Law_ 1 Ditto_ 200 William Barkley _ 1 Bedstead & Cord_ 0138 Mrs. Law_ 1 Walnut Chest_ 0150 Nancy Law _ 4 Ditto_ 060 Mrs. Law_ To Cupboard furniture_ 1160 Robert Warren_ 4 Cupboard_ 3127 Mrs. Law_ 1 Ladys Saddle_ 1100 Robert McClure _ 1 Mans Saddle_ 140 Mrs. Law_ 2 Spinning Wheels_ 0150 Peggy Law _ 1 Reel_ 046 Jesse Payne Senr Senior ._ 1 Cart_ 2100 William Brannon _ 1 Large Plough_ 224 Joseph White _ 4 Shovel Plough_ 0107 Joseph Kerlin_ 1 flax Brake_ 016 William Patton _ 2 Sheep_ 141 John Doake _ 2 Ditto_ 0152 ― Amount Carried Over £

body.value: Vendue List Continued from the Other Side Purchasers Names Articles Sold Price Amount Brought Over from the Other Side_ 3363 James Simpson _ 4 Black Ewe_ 096 Thomas Biddle _ 1 Red Cow_ 290 Thomas Biddle_ 1 Brindled Cow_ 260 Thomas Biddle_ 1 Dun Cow and Bell_ 330 Peggy Law 1 Roan Colt_ 820 John Barkley _ 1 Yearling Ditto_ 700 Mrs. Law_ 4 Black Mare_ 1004 Mrs. Law_ To a Quantity of flax_ 401 Peggy Law_ 1 Bed & Bedding_ 4101 Mrs. Law_ 1 Basket and Books_ 061 Tadok Willet _ 1 fire Shovel & tongs_ 0150 Ebenezer McEwen_ 10 Geese_ 171 Mrs. Law_ 3 Ditto_ 056 Henry Payne_ 1 Churn_ 076 ― Total Amt Amount . of Vendue_£ 7568 Sale Bill of James Laws Estate
